intro: Melica subflava, commonly known as the yellow brome, is a flowering plant species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands. The plant features slender,丛生 stems and narrow, grass-like leaves, with small, spike-like inflorescences that produce yellowish to brownish flowers. Melica subflava is often found in temperate climates and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Its botanical characteristics make it a common component of both natural and cultivated ecosystems.
